issue.title: DNS Challenges Not Added to Specified Ingress Despite Specifying in ACME ClusterIssuer Manifest

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
Hello everybody, 

I appreciate that anybody will read this at all. I started working with `cert-manager` today so hopefully my question is not too stupid - I believe that I have found a bug, but what do I know.  Before anything else, some stats :

- helm version : 3.9.0
- kubernetes version 
  - Client Version: v1.24.2
  - Kustomize Version: v4.5.4
  - Server Version: v1.22.6
- Cloud Provider : Azure
- Cloud Provision-er : Terraform with azurerm
- Installed cer-manager with [k8s](https://cert-manager.io/docs/installation/kubectl/#prerequisites)

Now I will describe the issue. I am using azure kubenetes services for some applications I am deploying. Alongside this I am using azure application gateway as my ingress. Here is my ingress configuration as well as my clusterIssuer configuration :

~~~yaml

---
apiVersion : cert-manager.io/v1
kind : ClusterIssuer
metadata :
  name : letsencrypt-issuer
spec :
  acme :
    email : adrian@myOrganization.com
    server : https://acme-v02.api.letsencrypt.org/directory
    privateKeySecretRef:
      name : myorg
    solvers :    
      - http01:
          ingress :
            name : myAzureApplicationGatewayIngress

---
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: 'myAzureApplicationGatewayIngress'
  namespace: 'my-namespace'
  annotations:
    kubernetes.io/ingress.class: azure/application-gateway
    cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: letsencrypt-issuer
spec :
  tls:
   - hosts :
        - 'mySite.com'
      secretName: 'ingress-letsencrypt-cert'
  rules :
    - http :
        paths :
          - path : '/'
            pathType : 'Prefix'
            backend :
              service :
                name : 'anApplication'
                port :
                  number : 8000
~~~

This does everything it should, besides adding the DNS challenge to my ingress. I can see this as `kubectl describe order` shows that the challenges were failed when attempting to `GET` `mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/<nastyStringHere>` when I describe the specified challenge. In particular, the status reported in the description has the following `Reason` section :

> Waiting for HTTP-01 challenge propagation: failed to perform self check GET request 'http://mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/\<nastyStringHere\>': Get "http://mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/\<NastyStringHere\>": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)

According to the documentation from `kubectl explain ClusterIssuer.spec.acme.solvers.http01.ingress.name`, said section should specify the ingress to which to add the DNS challenge to:

> The name of the ingress resource that should have ACME challenge solving     routes inserted into it in order to solve HTTP01 challenges. This is     typically used in conjunction with ingress controllers like ingress-gce,     which maintains a 1:1 mapping between external IPs and ingress resources.
> This mode should be avoided when using ingress controllers that expose a single IP for all ingress resources, as it can create compatibility problems with certain ingress-controller specific annotations.

From all this I have determined that this is likely the point of failure. I have considered using one of the azure dns-zone solutions instead, however, this appears to have a significant amount of overhead. The second line of the above would indicate that I ought to do otherwise, but what should I do in this case anyway?

Once more, thank you to anybody who even reads this,
Adrian

## Edits, etc

I found [this section of documentation about using an external load balancer](https://cert-manager.io/docs/configuration/acme/http01/externalloadbalancer/).



/kind bug

issue.title: Add Support for Contour HttpProxy (proof of concept included)

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
While Ingress objects work with Contour, Contour recommends using their httpproxy custom resource instead. This has lead to alot of Tanzu packages (which mostly use contour) to leverage httpproxies instead of the ingress object. This then limits users to either create a wild card certificate for all of contour or to submit a certificate resource for each httpproxy created

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Cert-manager has a framework in place for Ingress and Gateway objects to auto generate a Certificate object. it would be nice if the same could be done for Contour HttpProxies. I understand that this would not fit into the core Cert-Manger project but would be a nice addition to the satellite projects list. I have put together a working "side-car" controller that uses a similar approach as the ingress-shim, it can be found here: https://github.com/JefeDavis/contour-httpproxy-shim

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.-->

**Additional context**
would love to get something like this adopted as a satellite project for other users to be able to leverage

/kind feature

issue.title: HTTP01 solver fails self-check/propagation check on 1.7.1 when used with client-certificate auth on nginx Ingress 1.1.1

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
## Description
It seems as though HTTP01 challenges aren't working with ingress hosts that use client-certificate authentication. The self-check/propagation fails, leading to a cert not being issued.

## Steps to Reproduce
I have an ingress declared thusly:

```yaml
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: trusted-ingress
  annotations:
    cert-manager.io/issuer: letsencrypt-production
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-verify-client: "on"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-secret: "my-client-ca-cert"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-verify-depth: "1"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-pass-certificate-to-upstream: "false"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/rewrite-target: "/$1"
spec:
  ingressClassName: nginx
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - "trusted.example.com"
      secretName: trusted-tls-certificate
  rules:
    - host: "trusted.example.com"
      http:
        paths:
          - path: /(.*)
            pathType: Prefix
            backend:
              service:
                name: internal-service
                port:
                  number: 5000
```

## Actual Results
I get no certificate issued for this sub-domain, and see this in the logs constantly:
```
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839574       1 pod.go:59] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensurePod "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver pod" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Pod" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-sfc58" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839644       1 service.go:43] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensureService "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver Service for challenge resource" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Service" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-s8c6r" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839702       1 ingress.go:98] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensureIngress "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver ingress" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Ingress" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-x8dq7" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager E0221 03:34:29.849979       1 sync.go:186] cert-manager/challenges "msg"="propagation check failed" "error"="wrong status code '403', expected '200'" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
ingress-nginx ingress-nginx-controller-ccb6c766f-64hkw controller 10.6.0.113 - - [21/Feb/2022:03:34:29 +0000] "GET /.well-known/acme-challenge/-P6qqgqrAUtpv5vHQr84Pw3sU5lm5DkEtlJZJZAvVsM HTTP/1.1" 403 146 "-" "cert-manager/v1.7.1 (clean)" 207 0.000 [-] [] - - - - 0356eb59e8a04101df8824887d3ef609
ingress-nginx ingress-nginx-controller-ccb6c766f-64hkw controller 10.6.0.113 - - [21/Feb/2022:03:34:39 +0000] "GET /.well-known/acme-challenge/-P6qqgqrAUtpv5vHQr84Pw3sU5lm5DkEtlJZJZAvVsM HTTP/1.1" 403 146 "-" "cert-manager/v1.7.1 (clean)" 207 0.000 [-] [] - - - - 0227e2959a207a1aec96e5a291ab7d9f
```

Meanwhile, for `example.com` on the same cluster, I am not using any client-certificate authentication and the cert issues fine.

## Expected Behaviour
The certificate should get issued.

## Environment
- **Kubernetes version:** 1.22.4
- **Cloud-provider/provisioner:** AKS
- **cert-manager version:** 1.7.1
- **Install method:** Static manifests

/kind bug

issue.title: Investigate why Contour fails with "Gateway not found in cache" in some end-to-end Prow jobs

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: kind/flake
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a flaky test.

labels.name: flake/test-logic
labels.description: Indicates that the issue relates to test flakes caused by incorrect logic inside a test

issue.body:
| This is part of the "Reducing flakiness of our end-to-end suite" effort (https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/4950) |
|---|

Contour seems to have issues with its Gateway API implementation (or the issue comes from some unknown data race of ours). The Contour controller, sometimes, gets stuck with the following message appearing over and over:

```log
time="2022-03-10" level=info msg="Gateway not found in cache." context=GatewayAPIProcessor
```

This message usually appears 1 to 3 times:

```console
$ curl -sS https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4933/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501889408746393600/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-kprj4_9470876d-a8e7-4a8c-abf3-3cf68a2e8a30/contour/0.log \
  | grep -F "Gateway not found in cache" --count
1
```

With faulty jobs, the message appears over 3000 times:

```console
$ curl -sS https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/containers/contour-79bdf94f8-rtb5j_projectcontour_contour-efd515faf55c966dd5c82c8eaaebb4ab1c5d2d7a91be1e6bd7aed663c6bec656.log \
  | grep -F "Gateway not found in cache" --count
3129
```

Here is a list of jobs where numerous `Gateway not found in cache` messages were seen:
| PR | Prow job page | Contour logs | Number of occurences of the message |
|-|--|--|--|
| #4929 | [4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-rtb5j_d49b1634-9a82-4fca-a0a0-2b762bc4e97a/contour/0.log) | 3129 |
| #4994 | [4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23/1508530877703917568) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23/1508530877703917568/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-x5rqp_08dedf8a-8c72-45d2-90fd-66c929208814/contour/0.log) | 3038 |
| #4923 | [4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1500159559409340416) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1500159559409340416/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-zqg79_37d36121-b43d-454c-81e9-44a4c5a6e02a/contour/0.log) | 3017 |
| #4934 | [4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501886739935924224) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501886739935924224/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-kc5n7_ddebfd58-c9e7-49aa-ac08-347992351d1c/contour/0.log) | 3095 |
| #4983 | [4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1507057031587041280) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1507057031587041280/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-whdl2_5bf769ef-5650-4752-9379-e03a1e425173/contour/0.log) | 3245 |

I think we should investigate this issue since it is a source of flakiness.

/kind flake

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: kind/flake
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a flaky test.

labels.name: flake/test-setup
labels.description: Indicates that the issue relates to test flakes when setting up a test environment

issue.body:
`make -j e2e-setup` ran locally resulted in:
```
bin/tools/crane pull docker.io/eafxx/bind:latest-9f74179f bin/downloaded/containers/amd64/docker.io/eafxx/bind+latest-9f74179f@sha256+0b8c766f5bedbcbe559c7970c8e923aa0c4ca771e62fcf8dba64ffab980c9a51.tar --platform=linux/amd64
invalid checksum for "bin/downloaded/tools/helm-v3.8.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz": wanted "8408c91e846c5b9ba15eb6b1a5a79fc22dd4d33ac6ea63388e5698d1b2320c8b" but got "7e521ae56395ccb5ebb9214cc6cafd4b190a65185c3a38603e9346107a6e478a"
make: *** [make/tools.mk:162: bin/downloaded/tools/helm-v3.8.0-linux-amd64] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
bin/tools/crane pull docker.io/projectcontour/contour:v1.20.1 bin/downloaded/containers/amd64/docker.io/projectcontour/contour+v1.20.1@sha256+10f6501cbb8514549b2ae71634152fa1a02e4ba63a9a32955d2ff027a0da1254.tar --platform=linux/amd64
```

In this case `8408c91e846c5b9ba15eb6b1a5a79fc22dd4d33ac6ea63388e5698d1b2320c8b` was actually the correct checksum and the same command passed second time after running `rm -rf ./bin/*` and without the `-j` parameter.

**Environment details:**:
- Kubernetes version:
- Cloud-provider/provisioner:
- cert-manager version: latest master
- Install method: e.g. helm/static manifests

/kind bug

issue.title: Integration test flake: various timeouts

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: kind/flake
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a flaky test.

labels.name: flake/test-logic
labels.description: Indicates that the issue relates to test flakes caused by incorrect logic inside a test

issue.body:
Occassionally the integraton tests flake with errors that suggest that the resources spun up for integration tests (apiserver, test webhook) are not healthy:

```
...
=== Failed
=== FAIL: test/integration/certificaterequests Test_ConditionsListType (43.67s)
    testwebhook.go:127: Failed waiting for ListenPort to be allocated (got error: timed out waiting for the condition)

=== FAIL: test/integration/ctl TestCtlCreateCRBeforeCRIsCreated (40.01s)
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "certificaterequests.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "certificates.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "challenges.acme.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "clusterissuers.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "issuers.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "orders.acme.cert-manager.io"
    apiserver.go:139: context deadline exceeded

=== FAIL: test/integration/ctl/migrate TestCtlUpgradeMigrate_FailsIfStorageVersionDoesNotEqualTargetVersion (31.21s)
    apiserver.go:121: Found CRD with name "testtypes.testgroup.testing.cert-manager.io"
    helpers.go:100: Our GVK isn't loaded into the OpenAPI resources API after waiting for 2 minutes timed out waiting for the condition

=== FAIL: test/integration/validation TestValidationCertificate/Happy_path_returns_no_errors (42.01s)
    testwebhook.go:127: Failed waiting for ListenPort to be allocated (got error: timed out waiting for the condition)
    --- FAIL: TestValidationCertificate/Happy_path_returns_no_errors (42.01s)

=== FAIL: test/integration/validation TestValidationCertificate (70.33s)
```

https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/5196/pull-cert-manager-make-test/1534856885339951104/build-log.txt

Perhaps this is an issue with resource consumption.

/kind bug

issue.body:
e2e test flake: it appears that sometimes the tools needed to run the e2e tests (specifically `ytt`) aren't setup properly, see i.e https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/logs/ci-cert-manager-e2e-feature-gates-disabled-v1-23/1532799342669205504/build-log.txt

```
Waiting for kubectl cluster-info to be up to date...
bin/tools/ytt --data-value service_ip_prefix="10.96.0" \
	--file make/config/projectcontour/contour-gateway.yaml \
	--file make/config/projectcontour/gateway.yaml | bin/tools/kubectl apply -f-
/bin/bash: bin/tools/ytt: Permission denied
error: no objects passed to apply
```

Looking at the test output, I cannot see `ytt` being downloaded.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt
issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt
issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

-->

```

pull_request.body:

<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

addresses: https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/5375

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Corey McGalliard <cmcgalliard@redventures.com>

### Pull Request Motivation

Hey! we met at kubecon - I chatted about wanting to help contribute to this project because cert-manager been super beneficial for my team!  I grabbed a good-first-issue and here's the PR for Issue #5295 I was able to build and run this locally - but am having issues running the test suite locally. 

### Kind
feature 

### Release Note
This PR gives us the ability to allow changing acmesolver pod SecurityContext - this will be helpful to use the newer `kubectl debug ... ` commands as well as having the ability to use sidecar pods that run as root.

issue.title: Provide the ability to recover a Certificate request from an Error state

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The underlying problem is in one of the downstream projects used by cert-manager. 
Steps to reproduce is documented [here](https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/issues/239)  

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Provide a retry mechanism with the ability to invoke the certificate `reset` API so the certificate request can be successful. 
 
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Only alternative at this time is to manually reset a certificate object that is in error state by logging into the Venafi UI.
 
**Additional context**
While the scenario to reproduce as documented [here]( https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/issues/239) involves stopping a downstream service, the error could happen for various reasons. Not all may be recoverable.

/kind feature

issue.title: Fixes whitespace lint error
issue.body:
Closes #212

This dash was causing a whitespace problem which causes `helm lint` to fail. 

Before
```
$ helm lint awspca/aws-privateca-issuer

==> Linting awspca/aws-privateca-issuer
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended
[ERROR] templates/rbac.yaml: unable to parse YAML: invalid Yaml document separator: apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1

Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 1 chart(s) failed
```

After 
```
$ helm lint awspca/aws-privateca-issuer

==> Linting awspca/aws-privateca-issuer
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended

1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed

Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed
```

Signed-off-by: Kevin <kevin@stealsyour.pw>

issue.title: cert-manager v1.10.0 / OLM bundle v1.10.1 -  fix webhook tls arguments
issue.body:
The webhook container name had been renamed in https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/pull/5410 which caused the python hack script in `hacks/fixup-csv` to no longer modify the webhook arguments.
It highlights the fragility of that script and I've added an `else` clause which will cause the script to fail if the webhook container should change in the futurer.
But on reflection, it would probably be better to use patches to make these changes.
Patches would be easier to read and would fail if the underlying file context changes significantly and this problem might have been caught earlier.

I've decided to also start an OperatorHub cert-manager v1.10.1-rc release in this branch,
which means that the package version and the underlying cert-manager are no longer in sync, but I think this bug is important enough that we should do a quick release, rather than wait for the next patch release of cert-manager.

Fixes: #83 and https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/5551
* #83 
* https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/5551

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",

-->

feature

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver

issue.title: Slow healthz and livez endpoints cause liveness and readiness probe failures

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: priority/important-soon
labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
<!--
Bugs should be filed for issues encountered whilst operating cert-manager.
You should first attempt to resolve your issues through the community support
channels, e.g. Slack, in order to rule out individual configuration errors.
Please provide as much detail as possible. 
-->

**Describe the bug**:
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. 
Tip: you can use 
```
<code here>
```
for code blocks of your kubectl output or YAML files.
-->

After upgrading from 1.1 to 1.7.2 I have noticed increased webhook timeouts. We use fluxcd and that causes frequent reconciliation using server-side dry-run.

After looking at the pod, I can see frequent probe failures. And even restarts with exit code 0.

```
...
    State:          Running
      Started:      Tue, 17 May 2022 14:19:20 -0400
    Last State:     Terminated
      Reason:       Completed
      Exit Code:    0
      Started:      Tue, 17 May 2022 13:13:00 -0400
      Finished:     Tue, 17 May 2022 14:19:20 -0400
...
Events:
  Type     Reason     Age                   From     Message
  ----     ------     ----                  ----     -------
  Warning  Unhealthy  5m49s (x23 over 80m)  kubelet  Liveness probe failed: Get "http://10.28.11.22:6080/livez": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)
  Warning  Unhealthy  44s (x60 over 81m)    kubelet  Readiness probe failed: Get "http://10.28.11.22:6080/healthz": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)
```

Exploring the probes, I manually started probing using `kubectl port-forward`. I did notice that with some requests, the response could be pretty delayed, by a few seconds. The default probe timeout is `1s`, so I imagine that is the cause.


**Expected behaviour**:
<!--A concise description of what you expected to happen.-->

Faster probe response times.

**Steps to reproduce the bug**:
<!--Steps to reproduce the bug should be clear and easily reproducible to help people
gain an understanding of the problem.-->

Install cert-manager 1.7.2, trigger a webhook validation dry run every minute.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment details:**:
- Kubernetes version: 1.22
- Cloud-provider/provisioner: GKE
- cert-manager version: 1.7.2
- Install method: helm

/kind bug

After upgrading from 1.1 to 1.7.2 I have noticed increased webhook timeouts. We use fluxcd and that causes frequent reconciliation using server-side dry-run.

After looking at the pod, I can see frequent probe failures. And even restarts with exit code 0.

```
...
    State:          Running
      Started:      Tue, 17 May 2022 14:19:20 -0400
    Last State:     Terminated
      Reason:       Completed
      Exit Code:    0
      Started:      Tue, 17 May 2022 13:13:00 -0400
      Finished:     Tue, 17 May 2022 14:19:20 -0400
...
Events:
  Type     Reason     Age                   From     Message
  ----     ------     ----                  ----     -------
  Warning  Unhealthy  5m49s (x23 over 80m)  kubelet  Liveness probe failed: Get "http://10.28.11.22:6080/livez": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)
  Warning  Unhealthy  44s (x60 over 81m)    kubelet  Readiness probe failed: Get "http://10.28.11.22:6080/healthz": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)
```

Exploring the probes, I manually started probing using `kubectl port-forward`. I did notice that with some requests, the response could be pretty delayed, by a few seconds. The default probe timeout is `1s`, so I imagine that is the cause.


**Expected behaviour**:
<!--A concise description of what you expected to happen.-->

Faster probe response times.

**Steps to reproduce the bug**:
<!--Steps to reproduce the bug should be clear and easily reproducible to help people
gain an understanding of the problem.-->

Install cert-manager 1.7.2, trigger a webhook validation dry run every minute.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment details:**:
- Kubernetes version: 1.22
- Cloud-provider/provisioner: GKE
- cert-manager version: 1.7.2
- Install method: helm

/kind bug

issue.title: Add ability to configure podTemplate securityContext fields in http solver

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!--A clear and concise description of what the problem is-->
Using cert-manager in Pod Security Admission controlled namespaces [1] with e.g. restricted pod security standard [2] implies that some securityContext fields are required in order to run a pod. However currently only nodeSelector can be configured in http solver podTemplate [3]. So practically cert-manager http solver is not able to run in such environment. Adding ability to configure podTemplate securityContext fields in http solver (on pod and container level) would fix that.

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/pod-security-admission/
[2] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/pod-security-standards/#restricted
[3] https://cert-manager.io/docs/configuration/acme/http01/#podtemplate

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!--A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.-->
Add ability to configure podTemplate securityContext fields on pod and container level in http solver.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Less flexible approach would be to set restricted securityContext fields statically in http solver by adding:
```
securityContext:
  allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
  capabilities:
    drop:
    - ALL
  runAsNonRoot: true
  seccompProfile:
    type: RuntimeDefault
```

The drawback in this case would be: if pod security standard changes in some k8s version, those static fields would require to also change.

/kind feature

comment.body:
Issues go stale after 90d of inactivity.
Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`.
Stale issues rot after an additional 30d of inactivity and eventually close.
If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.
Send feedback to [jetstack](https://github.com/jetstack).

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**:
Unable to decode private key.

cert-manager version v1.8.2

`k describe issuer -n linkerd linkerd-trust-anchor `

```
Events:
  Type     Reason         Age              From                  Message
  ----     ------         ----             ----                  -------
  Warning  ErrGetKeyPair  2s (x3 over 7s)  cert-manager-issuers  Error getting keypair for CA issuer: error decoding private key PEM block
  Warning  ErrInitIssuer  2s (x3 over 7s)  cert-manager-issuers  Error initializing issuer: error decoding private key PEM block

```
```
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1
kind: Issuer
metadata:
  name: linkerd-trust-anchor
  namespace: linkerd
spec:
  ca:
    secretName: linkerd-trust-anchor
---

apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: linkerd-identity-issuer
  namespace: linkerd
spec:
  secretName: linkerd-identity-issuer
  duration: 48h
  renewBefore: 25h
  issuerRef:
    name: linkerd-trust-anchor
    kind: Issuer
  commonName: identity.linkerd.cluster.local
  dnsNames:
  - identity.linkerd.cluster.local
  isCA: true
  privateKey:
    algorithm: ECDSA
  usages:
  - cert sign
  - crl sign
  - server auth
  - client auth
```

```
# linkerd Mutual TLS certs
resource "tls_private_key" "linkerd_trust_anchor" {
  algorithm   = "ECDSA"
  ecdsa_curve = "P256"
}

resource "tls_self_signed_cert" "linkerd_trust_anchor_cert" {
#   key_algorithm         = tls_private_key.linkerd_trust_anchor.algorithm
  private_key_pem       = trimspace(tls_private_key.linkerd_trust_anchor.private_key_pem)
  validity_period_hours = 87600
  is_ca_certificate     = true

  subject {
    common_name = "identity.linkerd.cluster.local"
  }

  allowed_uses = [
    "crl_signing",
    "cert_signing",
    "server_auth",
    "client_auth"
  ]
}

resource "kubernetes_secret" "linkerd_trust_anchor" {
    depends_on = [
      tls_private_key.linkerd_trust_anchor,
      tls_self_signed_cert.linkerd_trust_anchor_cert
    ]
  type = "kubernetes.io/tls"
  metadata {
    name      = "linkerd-trust-anchor"
    namespace = "linkerd"
  }

  data = {
    "tls.crt" : tls_self_signed_cert.linkerd_trust_anchor_cert.cert_pem
    "tls.key" : trimspace(tls_self_signed_cert.linkerd_trust_anchor_cert.private_key_pem)
  }
}

# Deploy Issuer Cert For LinkerD via Cert Manager in LinkerD namespace
data "kubectl_file_documents" "docs" {
  content = file("./kubernetes/linkerd/issuer.yaml")
}

resource "kubectl_manifest" "linkerd_cert_manager_issuer" {
  depends_on = [
    kubernetes_namespace.linkerd,
    kubernetes_secret.linkerd_trust_anchor
  ]
  for_each  = data.kubectl_file_documents.docs.manifests
  yaml_body = each.value
}
```

**Expected behaviour**:
Decode should not be an issue.

**Environment details:**:
- Kubernetes version: v1.21
- Cloud-provider/provisioner: AWS/EKS
- cert-manager version:  v1.8.2
- Install method: helm

/kind bug

comment.body:
Stale issues rot after 30d of inactivity.
Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle rotten`.
Rotten issues close after an additional 30d of inactivity.
If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.
Send feedback to [jetstack](https://github.com/jetstack).
/lifecycle rotten
/remove-lifecycle stale

issue.title: Detect multiple certs pointed to the same secret

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

labels.description: Indicates a PR or issue relates to monitoring

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
If two certs are pointed at the same secret cert-manager will go into a cert ordering loop as the secret's never match what the other cert expects.

Here is a log example of that happening

- Install method (e.g. helm or static manifests): helm

/kind feature

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

issue.title: DNS Challenges Not Added to Specified Ingress Despite Specifying in ACME ClusterIssuer Manifest

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
Hello everybody, 

I appreciate that anybody will read this at all. I started working with `cert-manager` today so hopefully my question is not too stupid - I believe that I have found a bug, but what do I know.  Before anything else, some stats :

- helm version : 3.9.0
- kubernetes version 
  - Client Version: v1.24.2
  - Kustomize Version: v4.5.4
  - Server Version: v1.22.6
- Cloud Provider : Azure
- Cloud Provision-er : Terraform with azurerm
- Installed cer-manager with [k8s](https://cert-manager.io/docs/installation/kubectl/#prerequisites)

Now I will describe the issue. I am using azure kubenetes services for some applications I am deploying. Alongside this I am using azure application gateway as my ingress. Here is my ingress configuration as well as my clusterIssuer configuration :

~~~yaml

---
apiVersion : cert-manager.io/v1
kind : ClusterIssuer
metadata :
  name : letsencrypt-issuer
spec :
  acme :
    email : adrian@myOrganization.com
    server : https://acme-v02.api.letsencrypt.org/directory
    privateKeySecretRef:
      name : myorg
    solvers :    
      - http01:
          ingress :
            name : myAzureApplicationGatewayIngress

---
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: 'myAzureApplicationGatewayIngress'
  namespace: 'my-namespace'
  annotations:
    kubernetes.io/ingress.class: azure/application-gateway
    cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: letsencrypt-issuer
spec :
  tls:
   - hosts :
        - 'mySite.com'
      secretName: 'ingress-letsencrypt-cert'
  rules :
    - http :
        paths :
          - path : '/'
            pathType : 'Prefix'
            backend :
              service :
                name : 'anApplication'
                port :
                  number : 8000
~~~

This does everything it should, besides adding the DNS challenge to my ingress. I can see this as `kubectl describe order` shows that the challenges were failed when attempting to `GET` `mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/<nastyStringHere>` when I describe the specified challenge. In particular, the status reported in the description has the following `Reason` section :

> Waiting for HTTP-01 challenge propagation: failed to perform self check GET request 'http://mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/\<nastyStringHere\>': Get "http://mysite.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/\<NastyStringHere\>": context deadline exceeded (Client.Timeout exceeded while awaiting headers)

According to the documentation from `kubectl explain ClusterIssuer.spec.acme.solvers.http01.ingress.name`, said section should specify the ingress to which to add the DNS challenge to:

> The name of the ingress resource that should have ACME challenge solving     routes inserted into it in order to solve HTTP01 challenges. This is     typically used in conjunction with ingress controllers like ingress-gce,     which maintains a 1:1 mapping between external IPs and ingress resources.
> This mode should be avoided when using ingress controllers that expose a single IP for all ingress resources, as it can create compatibility problems with certain ingress-controller specific annotations.

From all this I have determined that this is likely the point of failure. I have considered using one of the azure dns-zone solutions instead, however, this appears to have a significant amount of overhead. The second line of the above would indicate that I ought to do otherwise, but what should I do in this case anyway?

Once more, thank you to anybody who even reads this,
Adrian

## Edits, etc

I found [this section of documentation about using an external load balancer](https://cert-manager.io/docs/configuration/acme/http01/externalloadbalancer/).



/kind bug

issue.title: Add Support for Contour HttpProxy (proof of concept included)

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
While Ingress objects work with Contour, Contour recommends using their httpproxy custom resource instead. This has lead to alot of Tanzu packages (which mostly use contour) to leverage httpproxies instead of the ingress object. This then limits users to either create a wild card certificate for all of contour or to submit a certificate resource for each httpproxy created

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Cert-manager has a framework in place for Ingress and Gateway objects to auto generate a Certificate object. it would be nice if the same could be done for Contour HttpProxies. I understand that this would not fit into the core Cert-Manger project but would be a nice addition to the satellite projects list. I have put together a working "side-car" controller that uses a similar approach as the ingress-shim, it can be found here: https://github.com/JefeDavis/contour-httpproxy-shim

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.-->

**Additional context**
would love to get something like this adopted as a satellite project for other users to be able to leverage

/kind feature

issue.title: HTTP01 solver fails self-check/propagation check on 1.7.1 when used with client-certificate auth on nginx Ingress 1.1.1

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
## Description
It seems as though HTTP01 challenges aren't working with ingress hosts that use client-certificate authentication. The self-check/propagation fails, leading to a cert not being issued.

## Steps to Reproduce
I have an ingress declared thusly:

```yaml
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: trusted-ingress
  annotations:
    cert-manager.io/issuer: letsencrypt-production
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-verify-client: "on"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-secret: "my-client-ca-cert"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-verify-depth: "1"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/auth-tls-pass-certificate-to-upstream: "false"
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/rewrite-target: "/$1"
spec:
  ingressClassName: nginx
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - "trusted.example.com"
      secretName: trusted-tls-certificate
  rules:
    - host: "trusted.example.com"
      http:
        paths:
          - path: /(.*)
            pathType: Prefix
            backend:
              service:
                name: internal-service
                port:
                  number: 5000
```

## Actual Results
I get no certificate issued for this sub-domain, and see this in the logs constantly:
```
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839574       1 pod.go:59] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensurePod "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver pod" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Pod" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-sfc58" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839644       1 service.go:43] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensureService "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver Service for challenge resource" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Service" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-s8c6r" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager I0221 03:34:29.839702       1 ingress.go:98] cert-manager/challenges/http01/selfCheck/http01/ensureIngress "msg"="found one existing HTTP01 solver ingress" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "related_resource_kind"="Ingress" "related_resource_name"="cm-acme-http-solver-x8dq7" "related_resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "related_resource_version"="v1" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
cert-manager cert-manager-6d8d6b5dbb-9dqwh cert-manager E0221 03:34:29.849979       1 sync.go:186] cert-manager/challenges "msg"="propagation check failed" "error"="wrong status code '403', expected '200'" "dnsName"="trusted.example.com" "resource_kind"="Challenge" "resource_name"="postmam-trusted-tls-certificate-hdh2z-3198732913-1304032814" "resource_namespace"="postmam-dev" "resource_version"="v1" "type"="HTTP-01"
ingress-nginx ingress-nginx-controller-ccb6c766f-64hkw controller 10.6.0.113 - - [21/Feb/2022:03:34:29 +0000] "GET /.well-known/acme-challenge/-P6qqgqrAUtpv5vHQr84Pw3sU5lm5DkEtlJZJZAvVsM HTTP/1.1" 403 146 "-" "cert-manager/v1.7.1 (clean)" 207 0.000 [-] [] - - - - 0356eb59e8a04101df8824887d3ef609
ingress-nginx ingress-nginx-controller-ccb6c766f-64hkw controller 10.6.0.113 - - [21/Feb/2022:03:34:39 +0000] "GET /.well-known/acme-challenge/-P6qqgqrAUtpv5vHQr84Pw3sU5lm5DkEtlJZJZAvVsM HTTP/1.1" 403 146 "-" "cert-manager/v1.7.1 (clean)" 207 0.000 [-] [] - - - - 0227e2959a207a1aec96e5a291ab7d9f
```

Meanwhile, for `example.com` on the same cluster, I am not using any client-certificate authentication and the cert issues fine.

## Expected Behaviour
The certificate should get issued.

## Environment
- **Kubernetes version:** 1.22.4
- **Cloud-provider/provisioner:** AKS
- **cert-manager version:** 1.7.1
- **Install method:** Static manifests

issue.title: Investigate why Contour fails with "Gateway not found in cache" in some end-to-end Prow jobs

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: kind/flake
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a flaky test.

labels.name: flake/test-logic
labels.description: Indicates that the issue relates to test flakes caused by incorrect logic inside a test

issue.body:
| This is part of the "Reducing flakiness of our end-to-end suite" effort (https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/4950) |
|---|

Contour seems to have issues with its Gateway API implementation (or the issue comes from some unknown data race of ours). The Contour controller, sometimes, gets stuck with the following message appearing over and over:

```log
time="2022-03-10" level=info msg="Gateway not found in cache." context=GatewayAPIProcessor
```

This message usually appears 1 to 3 times:

```console
$ curl -sS https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4933/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501889408746393600/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-kprj4_9470876d-a8e7-4a8c-abf3-3cf68a2e8a30/contour/0.log \
  | grep -F "Gateway not found in cache" --count
1
```

With faulty jobs, the message appears over 3000 times:

```console
$ curl -sS https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/containers/contour-79bdf94f8-rtb5j_projectcontour_contour-efd515faf55c966dd5c82c8eaaebb4ab1c5d2d7a91be1e6bd7aed663c6bec656.log \
  | grep -F "Gateway not found in cache" --count
3129
```

Here is a list of jobs where numerous `Gateway not found in cache` messages were seen:
| PR | Prow job page | Contour logs | Number of occurences of the message |
|-|--|--|--|
| #4929 | [4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4929/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501497109084377088/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-rtb5j_d49b1634-9a82-4fca-a0a0-2b762bc4e97a/contour/0.log) | 3129 |
| #4994 | [4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23/1508530877703917568) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4994/pull-cert-manager-make-e2e-v1-23/1508530877703917568/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-x5rqp_08dedf8a-8c72-45d2-90fd-66c929208814/contour/0.log) | 3038 |
| #4923 | [4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1500159559409340416) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4923/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1500159559409340416/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-zqg79_37d36121-b43d-454c-81e9-44a4c5a6e02a/contour/0.log) | 3017 |
| #4934 | [4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501886739935924224) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4934/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1501886739935924224/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-kc5n7_ddebfd58-c9e7-49aa-ac08-347992351d1c/contour/0.log) | 3095 |
| #4983 | [4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23](https://prow.build-infra.jetstack.net/view/gs/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1507057031587041280) | [0.log](https://storage.googleapis.com/jetstack-logs/pr-logs/pull/cert-manager_cert-manager/4983/pull-cert-manager-e2e-v1-23/1507057031587041280/artifacts/cert-manager-e2e-logs/kind-control-plane/pods/projectcontour_contour-79bdf94f8-whdl2_5bf769ef-5650-4752-9379-e03a1e425173/contour/0.log) | 3245 |

I think we should investigate this issue since it is a source of flakiness.

/kind flake

<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

issue.title: Makefile flake when checking shasums

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

labels.name: kind/flake
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a flaky test.

labels.name: flake/test-setup
labels.description: Indicates that the issue relates to test flakes when setting up a test environment

issue.body:
`make -j e2e-setup` ran locally resulted in:
```
bin/tools/crane pull docker.io/eafxx/bind:latest-9f74179f bin/downloaded/containers/amd64/docker.io/eafxx/bind+latest-9f74179f@sha256+0b8c766f5bedbcbe559c7970c8e923aa0c4ca771e62fcf8dba64ffab980c9a51.tar --platform=linux/amd64
invalid checksum for "bin/downloaded/tools/helm-v3.8.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz": wanted "8408c91e846c5b9ba15eb6b1a5a79fc22dd4d33ac6ea63388e5698d1b2320c8b" but got "7e521ae56395ccb5ebb9214cc6cafd4b190a65185c3a38603e9346107a6e478a"
make: *** [make/tools.mk:162: bin/downloaded/tools/helm-v3.8.0-linux-amd64] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
bin/tools/crane pull docker.io/projectcontour/contour:v1.20.1 bin/downloaded/containers/amd64/docker.io/projectcontour/contour+v1.20.1@sha256+10f6501cbb8514549b2ae71634152fa1a02e4ba63a9a32955d2ff027a0da1254.tar --platform=linux/amd64
```

In this case `8408c91e846c5b9ba15eb6b1a5a79fc22dd4d33ac6ea63388e5698d1b2320c8b` was actually the correct checksum and the same command passed second time after running `rm -rf ./bin/*` and without the `-j` parameter.

**Environment details:**:
- Kubernetes version:
- Cloud-provider/provisioner:
- cert-manager version: latest master
- Install method: e.g. helm/static manifests

/kind bug

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates that all commits in the pull request have the valid DCO sign-off message.

labels.name: area/deploy
labels.description: Indicates a PR modifies deployment configuration

labels.name: needs-kind
labels.description: Indicates a PR lacks a `kind/foo` label and requires one.

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt
issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. If this is your first time, read our contributor guidelines https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
3. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
4. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

Added PodDisruptionBudgets to helm chart. It is configurable via the values.yaml.

**Which issue this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close that issue when PR gets merged)*: fixes #3898

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
<!--  Steps to write your release note:
1. Use the release-note-* labels to set the release note state (if you have access)
2. Enter your extended release note in the below block; leaving it blank means using the PR title as the release note. If no release note is required, just write `NONE`.
-->
```release-note
Added PodDisruptionBudgets for cert-manager components to the Helm chart (disabled by default).
```

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver

issue.title: Ability to not create ca.crt

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

issue.body:
I have a self signed cert and I need it to be created without a ca.crt.

I was expecting setting isCA: false would not create a ca.crt in the secret.

#cert manager 1.1.0

```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: selfsigning-issuer
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  selfSigned: {}
```


```yml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1alpha2
kind: Certificate
metadata:
  name: gloo-cert
  namespace: gloo-system
spec:
  secretName: gloo-selfsigned-cert
  commonName: "gloo-selfsigned-cert"
  isCA: false
  issuerRef:
    name: selfsigning-issuer
    kind: ClusterIssuer
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65769106/105184374-470a1180-5afd-11eb-8275-14de6a011a83.png)

Hey! we met at kubecon - I chatted about wanting to help contribute to this project because cert-manager been super beneficial for my team!  I grabbed a good-first-issue and here's the PR for Issue #5295 I was able to build and run this locally - but am having issues running the test suite locally. 

### Kind
feature 

### Release Note
This PR gives us the ability to allow changing acmesolver pod SecurityContext - this will be helpful to use the newer `kubectl debug ... ` commands as well as having the ability to use sidecar pods that run as root.

issue.title: Provide the ability to recover a Certificate request from an Error state

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: lifecycle/stale
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR has remained open with no activity and has become stale.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The underlying problem is in one of the downstream projects used by cert-manager. 
Steps to reproduce is documented [here](https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/issues/239)  

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Provide a retry mechanism with the ability to invoke the certificate `reset` API so the certificate request can be successful. 
 
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Only alternative at this time is to manually reset a certificate object that is in error state by logging into the Venafi UI.
 
**Additional context**
While the scenario to reproduce as documented [here]( https://github.com/Venafi/vcert/issues/239) involves stopping a downstream service, the error could happen for various reasons. Not all may be recoverable.

/kind feature

comment.body:
Stale issues rot after 30d of inactivity.
Mark the issue as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle rotten`.
Rotten issues close after an additional 30d of inactivity.
If this issue is safe to close now please do so with `/close`.
Send feedback to [jetstack](https://github.com/jetstack).
/lifecycle rotten
/remove-lifecycle stale

issue.title: Fixes whitespace lint error
issue.body:
Closes #212

This dash was causing a whitespace problem which causes `helm lint` to fail. 

Before
```
$ helm lint awspca/aws-privateca-issuer

==> Linting awspca/aws-privateca-issuer
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended
[ERROR] templates/rbac.yaml: unable to parse YAML: invalid Yaml document separator: apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1

Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 1 chart(s) failed
```

After 
```
$ helm lint awspca/aws-privateca-issuer

==> Linting awspca/aws-privateca-issuer
[INFO] Chart.yaml: icon is recommended

1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed

Error: 1 chart(s) linted, 0 chart(s) failed
```

Signed-off-by: Kevin <kevin@stealsyour.pw>

issue.title: cert-manager v1.10.0 / OLM bundle v1.10.1 -  fix webhook tls arguments
issue.body:
The webhook container name had been renamed in https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/pull/5410 which caused the python hack script in `hacks/fixup-csv` to no longer modify the webhook arguments.
It highlights the fragility of that script and I've added an `else` clause which will cause the script to fail if the webhook container should change in the futurer.
But on reflection, it would probably be better to use patches to make these changes.
Patches would be easier to read and would fail if the underlying file context changes significantly and this problem might have been caught earlier.

I've decided to also start an OperatorHub cert-manager v1.10.1-rc release in this branch,
which means that the package version and the underlying cert-manager are no longer in sync, but I think this bug is important enough that we should do a quick release, rather than wait for the next patch release of cert-manager.

Fixes: #83 and https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/5551
* #83 
* https://github.com/cert-manager/cert-manager/issues/5551

issue.body:
<!--

Thanks for opening a pull request! Here are some tips to get everything merged smoothly:

1. Read our contributor guidelines: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/

2. Make sure your commits are signed off: https://cert-manager.io/docs/contributing/sign-off/

3. If the PR is unfinished, raise it as a draft or prefix the title with "WIP:" so it's clear to everyone.

4. Be sure to allow edits from maintainers so it's easier for us to help: https://help.github.com/en/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork

-->

### Pull Request Motivation

<!-- Explain the motivation behind this PR. If there's a related issue or PR, link to it here! -->

When deploying cert-manager using the Helm chart, overriding ACME HTTP-01 thanks to the extraArgs value doesn’t allow to only set the repository only without the tag (so that the default tag is used). This PR tries to address this issue.

### Kind

<!--

Pick a kind which best describes your PR from the following list:

	<cleanup | bug | feature | documentation | design | flake>

If you're unsure which is best or if you're not sure what we mean by "kind",
just ignore this section and a maintainer will fill it in for you!
-->

feature

### Release Note

<!--

Should we mention this PR in release notes? If so, replace "NONE" with a line of text explaining what changed!

For more details, see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md

-->

```release-note
Helm: allow configuring the image used by ACME HTTP-01 solver
```
